text: The Nandaigajan railway station in the Indian state of West Bengal, serves Nandaigajan, India in Purba Medinipur district. It is on the Howrah-Kharagpur line. It is from Howrah Station.Combined suburban Time Table - Eastern Railway, Metro Railway, South Eastern Railway ==History== It is a small railway station between Howrah and Kharagpur. Local EMU trains stop here. The Howrah-Kharagpur line was opened in 1900. The Howrah-Panskura stretch has three lines. The Howrah-Kharagpur line was electrified in 1967–69. ==References== ==External links== *Trains at Nandaigajan Category:Railway stations in Purba Medinipur district Category:Kolkata Suburban Railway stations
title: Nandaigajan railway station
